page.title: 08PLYMSTOCK SCHOOL
page.content: Plymstock School is the largest school in the area. Opened in 1911, it became a comprehensive school in 1965 and at its peak in the mid 1970's had about 2400 pupils aged 11 to 18 and was one of the{biggest schools in the {country}.With the opening of a second comprehensive school, Coombe Dean, in the area, numbers have now declined to 1400. All pupils, including 6th formers wear{uniform}which is mainly navy blue with yellow in the badge and tie. All the traditional subjects are taught but recently there has been a shift towards{science and technology and the school now has 34{computers which are constantly in use. The extensive grounds are used for a wide range of sporting activities although parts have recently been sold for housing development. The school has its own sports hall and swimming pool.
